business.headline: Metal, IT stock help markets end higher ahead of TCS Q2 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 398.44 points to end at 82,172.10, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.65 points to close at 25,181.80.

Funding dispute at Tata International behind deepening rift in Tata Trusts: ReportThe Rs 1,000 crore capital infusion plans for the loss-making Tata International, chaired by Noel Tata, has turned into the latest flashpoint in the widening divide within one of India's most powerful charitable trusts.
Radhika Gupta explains why a 50:50 gold–silver split works for investorsRadhika Gupta explains how a balanced approach to gold and silver investing can help investors navigate volatility with ease.

Has India started paying for Russian oil in Chinese yuan?Traders supplying Russian crude have reportedly asked Indian state refiners to settle a few recent shipments in yuan instead of the usual dollars or UAE dirhams.

Mukesh Ambani only centibillionaire in Forbes India's 100 RichestWith a net worth of $105 billion, Ambani has maintained his lead as the country's wealthiest individual. At the second position is Gautam Adani and family, with a fortune of $92 billion.

Irony unfolds: Front-page ads hail Ratan Tata as guiding light amid internal feudThe internal turmoil within Tata Trusts, the majority shareholder in Tata Sons, has coincided with the first death anniversary of Ratan Tata.

How is Jewar International Airport shaping Noida's next big real estate boomBeyond serving as a travel gateway, Jewar International Airport is poised to power NCR's economic and real estate growth. The project has already fuelled rising demand in areas like the Yamuna Expressway, Noida Extension, and Greater Noida.

Gold and silver prices dip slightly after record highs. Should you buy or sell?After touching record highs earlier this week, gold and silver prices cooled off slightly on Thursday as investors booked profits. With both metals still near lifetime peaks, the big question is—should you buy the dip or wait for further correction?

Pharma shares rally after report hints tariff relief for genericsThe Nifty Pharma and Healthcare indices opened strong, gaining 1.14% each, as optimism spread across the market. Almost all major pharmaceutical and healthcare companies traded higher.

Looking to invest? These stocks could be worth your moneyMarket experts suggest that metals, healthcare, banking, and even commodities like silver continue to show strength and could offer attractive short-term opportunities.

TCS Q2 results: From layoffs to muted growth expectations, 8 key things to knowTCS's Q2 results will set the tone for India's $250-billion IT industry, testing its resilience amid layoffs, wage pressures, and AI disruption. It will also reveal whether India's tech titan can still outpace global headwinds.

Lupin share price rises over 3% in early trade. What's driving the rally?At around 9:28 am, shares of Lupin were trading at Rs 1,968.75, up Rs 63.05, or 3.31%, on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Read to know what's driving the rally in shares of the pharma company.

Sensex, Nifty gain as Q2 earnings remain in focus; pharma stocks gainAt around 9:21 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading 92.15 points higher at 81,865.81, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 40 points to 25,086.15. Broader market indices also saw modest gains, indicating a largely positive but measured start to the session.

LG Electronics IPO: Here's how much you can earn per share if you bid todayLG India IPO has received a strong response from investors since opening for subscription on October 7. According to exchange data available till October 8 (Day 2), the issue was subscribed 3.33 times overall.

Tata Capital IPO allotment today: Check status and if bumper listing awaitsTata Capital IPO opened for bidding on October 6 and saw decent interest from institutional investors, while retail participation remained moderate.

How much can you earn if you invest iPhone 17 Pro EMIs in a 36-month SIP?If a buyer converts the iPhone 17 Pro's price into a 36-month EMI plan, it roughly comes to Rs 4,200 per month, which is a decent amount to invest in an SIP.

Tata history: From opium wars to boardroom battles, the making of an Indian empireThe history of Tata Group, caught in a boardroom war, is a remarkable tale of ambition, daring ventures, and resilience. This three-part series will explore how a humble family business evolved into India's largest industrial conglomerate, navigating fortunes made from the opium trade and wartime cotton booms, and the enduring challenges that defined its legacy.

Sebi aims to strengthen markets with easier share lending and borrowing: ReportSebi is holding consultations with market participants to improve the Securities Lending and Borrowing (SLB) mechanism, thereby allowing investors to lend or borrow shares for a fee, helping traders take short positions and aiding in better price discovery.

Sensex, Nifty slip as investors book profits; Titan, IT stocks shineThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points to close below the 82,000 mark, while the Nifty50 slipped more than 60 points to settle just above 25,000. Broader market indices also ended lower, reflecting heightened volatility throughout the day.

Subscribe or skip: Should you ride the ongoing IPO wave on Dalal Street?The IPO rush is exciting, but are investors chasing glitter or real growth? With many listings already below issue price, will patience and selectivity matter more than speed this year?

entertainment.headline: Hollywood's The Lost Bus accused of copying Prabhas's Salaar score. Internet reacts Fans of Prabhas' 'Salaar' have sparked a heated debate online after spotting striking similarities between its background score and the promo music of Hollywood's 'The Lost Bus' starring Matthew McConaughey.

Sweet to sinister: When nice guys turned evil Many actors who began with comic, romantic, or supporting roles hit the spotlight playing villain on screen. From Raghav Juyal to Jitendra Kumar, these negative roles have showcased the range of actors and left a lasting impact on audiences.

Rajat Bedi says Mukesh Khanna blew up his statement on fallout with Rakesh Roshan Actor Rajat Bedi stated that veteran actor Mukesh Khanna misquoted him on a podcast. He clarified his reasons for leaving the industry and addressed misunderstandings involving filmmaker Rakesh Roshan.

Kartik Aaryan-Anurag Basu film finally gets title, and it's pure Aashiqui nostalgia Kartik Aaryan and Anurag Basu's film has reportedly been titled 'Tu Meri Zindagi Hai' after distancing from 'Aashiqui' franchise. The film is planned as a major summer romance release, aiming for a May 2026 release.

Rajinikanth visits Babaji caves during Himalayan trip, meets fans en route. Pics Superstar Rajinikanth visited Mahavatar Babaji caves and other holy sites during his Himalayan tour. He was seen posing for photos and obliging for selfies.

Elvish Yadav visits Premanand's ashram, vows to chant Radha 10,000 times daily Elvish Yadav revealed a calmer side during his visit to Premanand Maharaj's ashram in Vrindavan, pledging to chant "Radha" 10,000 times a day. A video of him listening to the saint's advice has gone viral.

The Taj Story teaser: Paresh Rawal asks, 'Is the Taj Mahal a tomb or temple? Paresh Rawal's 'The Taj Story' teaser is out. The film that imposes thought-provoking questions about history and faith, will release in theatres on October 31.

Anand L Rai shares BTS post from Tere Ishk Mein as Dhanush shoots in Delhi cold Director Aanand L Rai shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse of actor Dhanush filming 'Tere Ishk Mein' in Delhi's cold. The upcoming romantic-drama also features Kriti Sanon in a pivotal character.

Union Minister Bhupender Yadav meets Rishab Shetty, praises Kantara's green theme Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav met Rishab Shetty in New Delhi to praise his latest film, 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. The minister highlighted Shetty's efforts in promoting environmental awareness through cinema.

Saoirse Ronan to play Linda McCartney in Sam Mendes's Beatles biopic series Hollywood actor Saoirse Ronan is cast as Linda McCartney in Sam Mendes's upcoming Beatles film series. Each film will focus on an individual member of the band and feature intersecting storylines.

Akshay Kumar recalls Madonna walking out of his-SRK's show named Awesome Foursome Akshay Kumar shared a past incident involving Madonna leaving a live show mid-way. The event featured performances from Shah Rukh Khan, Kajol, and Juhi Chawla. A singer's impromptu song for Madonna led to her early departure.

Travis Kelce on fiancee Taylor Swift's new album: Proud boyfriend, terrified son Taylor Swift's new album 'The Life of a Showgirl' has stirred some fun in the Kelce household, especially over the track 'Wood', which fans think nods to Travis Kelce. On their podcast New Heights, Jason and Travis joked about the song's cheeky lyrics, with Travis admitting he's nervous about how their dad might take it.

George Clooney: Ocean's 14 on the way, filming likely from next year George Clooney is likely to return with franchise co-stars Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Don Cheadle in 'Ocean's 14'. The film is likely to go on floors in 2026

Dude trailer: Pradeep Ranganathan navigates unrequited love and self-discovery The trailer of 'Dude', starring Pradeep Ranganathan and Mamitha Baiju in lead roles, released on October 9. The film explores themes of love, loss, and healing through a comedic narrative.

Taylor Swift laughs off Travis Kelce's mix-up with Hugh Grant and Greta Gerwig Taylor Swift shares an anecdote involving Travis Kelce's confusion between Hugh Grant's wife and Greta Gerwig. The story was revealed during Swift's appearance on Late Night with Seth Meyers.

Robin Williams' daughter urges fans to stop sharing AI-generated videos of him Zelda Williams requests an end to AI-generated videos of her father, Robin Williams. Actor and union voices express unease about AI recreations and digital performers.

Raghav Juyal on shedding dancer label: Took a break and learned to say no In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, dancer-turned-actor Raghav Juyal spoke about getting off his dancer tag and aiming to become the next superstar.

Rajvir Jawanda's viral video with Rs 31 lakh bike sparks road safety talks in India Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda died in a bike accident near Baddi, Himachal Pradesh. Fans and social media users blame poor road conditions and lack of enforcement as the singer's video with his Rs 31 lakh bike goes viral.

Saif Ali Khan on claims that knife attack on him was fake: Kind of world we live Saif Ali Khan calmly walked out of hospital after a knife attack, sparking social media scepticism about the incident's authenticity. He clarified on a talk show that his composed exit was meant to reassure fans and family, not create drama.

general news.headline: No FIR as powerful cops named in suicide note: Haryana cop's wife in letter to CMIn her letter, citing her husband's suicide note, she said that all details of the higher-ups involved in his "harassment, humiliation, and mental torture" have been ignored by the Chandigarh Police, even days after his death.

Everything I have seen here...: UK PM counters Trump's 'dead economy' jibeWith Prime Minister Narendra Modi by his side, UK PM Keir Starmer asserted that India was well on track to become the world's third-largest economy by 2028.

You'll be found in 50 pieces: UP Governor's 2nd shocker on live-in relationshipsGovernor Anandiben Patel's latest remarks came a day after she claimed that one only needs to visit an orphanage to see the outcome of a live-in relationship, where girls, some as young as 15, line up with babies in their arms.

Jaish announces first women's unit, to be led by Masood Azhar's sisterAccording to sources, the JeM's women's wing will be led by Sadiya Azhar, the sister of Masood Azhar. Her husband, Yusuf Azhar, was among the family members of Azhar who were eliminated by strikes as part of India's Operation Sindoor on May 7.

Rawalpindi Chicken Tikka Masala, Bahawalpur Naan: IAF roasts Pak with dinner menuIn an apparent dig at Pakistan over the Air Force's successful strikes during Operation Sindoor, the menu mocked the damage inflicted on Islamabad - from hitting the Bholari airbase to obliterating Lashkar terror camps in Muridke.

Master it before it masters you: Kalli Purie on AI disrupting newsroomsIndia Today vice chairperson Kalli Purie, speaking at FICCI Frames 2025, stressed that the right approach to AI was not to be fearful of new technology but to master it by jumping in feet first.

IND vs SA Live: South Africa opt to bowl, Amanjot Kaur returnsINDW vs SAW live score, Women's World Cup: South Africa have won the toss and opted to bowl first in Vizag. Amanjot Kaur has returned and has replaced Renuka Singh. The Proteas has replaced Masabata Klaas with Tumi Sekhukhune.

Has the elephant woken up after 4 years?After years of silence and dwindling electoral fortune, Mayawati's BSP is stirring things up. On Thursday, Mayawati addressed a BSP rally that was also a show of strength. Lucknow got painted in the BSP blue. Mayawati attacked the Samajwadi Party and the Congress, in a bid to reclaim her political space and constituents.

Everest didn't find Everest: An Indian did, and history forgot himRadhanath Sikdar was the first person to calculate the height of Mount Everest in 1852. He did it using different stations. Yet when the world learned of the tallest peak, it wasn't his name that stayed.

Coldrif cough syrup maker shut permanently over child deaths, owner arrestedAccording to the police, Ranganathan was arrested last night and will be taken to Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district - where most of the deaths have been reported - after securing transit remand. The arrest happened shortly after he was detained for questioning by the Madhya Pradesh Police.

Raghav Juyal on shedding dancer label: Took a break and learned to say noIn an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, dancer-turned-actor Raghav Juyal spoke about getting off his dancer tag and aiming to become the next superstar.

One government job for every family: Tejashwi Yadav's big promise to BiharTejashwi Yadav announced that if the INDIA bloc comes to power in Bihar, a new law will ensure every family gets at least one government job within 20 months.

The Baahubali Bible: Inside the massive guide, a glue that holds the franchiseThe Baahubali Bible is the foundation of the franchise's detailed universe. Producer Shobu Yarlagadda, in an exclusive interview with India Today, talked about the world building, the massive bible that governs the franchise.

JNU's crisis deepens: 36% academic budget cut, women and research students vanishA new JNUTA report reveals JNU's academic funds have plunged 36%, while women and research student numbers have fallen to 40%, signalling a sharp decline in the university's academic strength. The revelations are raising alarm over whether India's premier public university is being quietly dismantled.

India's Taliban Tango: A pragmatic move to reclaim influence in AfghanistanIndia's invitation to Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi marks a cautious diplomatic reset, driven by shifting geopolitics and regional competition with China.

How the Navi Mumbai Airport came up at Mach 3 speedIn little more than a year, Mumbai's second airport went from barren land to a functional terminal. The fast turnaround of the Navi Mumbai airport shows that when political hurdles give way to intent, India can deliver world-class infrastructure in record time. Most of the construction, according to locals, drone footage and maps, happened in about a year.

Rare sight: Mount Everest visible from Bihar town thanks to clear skies, clean airLocated on the banks of the Kamla River, which originates from a glacier in Nepal along the India-Nepal border, Jaynagar is a culturally vibrant town where the world's highest peak appears directly in line on the map.

A CM falls after brush with two women in Imran Khan's lifeFrom inside Rawalpindi's Adiala Jail, Imran Khan ordered the removal of his only sitting chief minister, Ali Amin Gandapur of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. This casualty of PTI's only CM is seemingly a result of his power struggle with two most influential women in Khan's life, his wife Bushra Bibi and his sister Aleema Khan. Though Aleema and Bushra don't see eye to eye, this was a rare alignment of the two to unseat Gandapur.

Supreme Court rules pre-2022 surrogacy couples not bound by age limitsThe Supreme Court ruled that the age limits for intending parents will not apply retrospectively to couples who had begun the surrogacy process before the Surrogacy (Regulation) Act came into effect on January 25, 2022.

Tussle at Tata, the 2016 sagaAn ongoing tussle within the Tata Group has made the Union government call its leadership in for a meeting. We revisit the last time intrigue gripped the highest ranks of the salt-to-aerospace conglomerate.

I am an orthopaedic doctor and this is how I care for my knees and bonesAn orthopaedic surgeon reveals his golden rules for maintaining joint health through balanced exercise and nutrition. Every extra kilo adds more stress to the knees.

Trump racing for Nobel Peace Prize day before announcement, White House cheers onIn a well-timed tweet, the White House called Donald Trump "peace President" after Israel and Hamas agreed to the first phase of his Gaza plan, a day before the Nobel Peace Prize for 2025 – which the 79-year-old has been eyeing – was announced.

Top Haryana cop sent will to wife, ignored her frantic calls day before suicideSenior Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, who shot himself dead at his home in Chandigarh, drafted a will and sent that along with the 9-page suicide note to his wife, senior IAS officer, Amneet P Kumar, the day before. The receipt caused her to panic, and she called him 15 times, but all went unanswered.

Irony unfolds: Front-page ads hail Ratan Tata as guiding light amid internal feudThe internal turmoil within Tata Trusts, the majority shareholder in Tata Sons, has coincided with the first death anniversary of Ratan Tata.

Homebound's Vishal Jethwa on overcoming nepotism: Crying about it gets you nowherevVishal Jethwa opens up about the challenges outsiders face in Bollywood. He emphasises that hard work and merit, not nepotism, have shaped his career.

Hollywood's The Lost Bus accused of copying Prabhas's Salaar score. Internet reactsFans of Prabhas' 'Salaar' have sparked a heated debate online after spotting striking similarities between its background score and the promo music of Hollywood's 'The Lost Bus' starring Matthew McConaughey.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill sets his challenge as India captain: Want to play and win in all formats India captain Shubman Gill made his intentions clear during the pre-match press conference ahead of the second Test against West Indies in New Delhi, stating that his goal is to play and win titles across all formats. Gill was recently promoted as India's ODI captain, adding to his role as Test skipper.

Harleen Deol recalls special MS Dhoni chat during tough injury layoff Women's World Cup: Harleen Deol fondly recalled her inspiring interaction with MS Dhoni during her six-month injury layoff, calling him her idol both on and off the field.

Watch: Drop-in pitches gets installed at MCG ahead of India's tour of Australia The Melbourne Cricket Ground is ready to welcome the Indian team for their white-ball series down under. Ahead of summer, the ground is transitioning from a football field to a cricket ground.

Shubman Gill backs Sai Sudharsan amidst Test struggles: Still trust him at no.3 India captain Shubman Gill has backed Sai Sudharsan despite early struggles in Test cricket. Gill emphasised patience, highlighting Sudharsan's potential and reaffirming his belief that the youngster can hold India's No. 3 spot long-term.

Rohit, Virat strongly in the mix for ODI World Cup 2027: Gill India captain Shubman Gill has cleared the air on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's futures in ODI cricket. Shubman has said that the duo are firmly in India's plans for the ODI World Cup 2027.

IND vs SA Live: South Africa opt to bowl, Amanjot Kaur returns INDW vs SAW live score, Women's World Cup: South Africa have won the toss and opted to bowl first in Vizag. Amanjot Kaur has returned and has replaced Renuka Singh. The Proteas has replaced Masabata Klaas with Tumi Sekhukhune.

West Indians will not be able to deny Cummins' rumoured IPL deal: Akash Chopra Pat Cummins and Travis Head reportedly rejected a massive Rs 58 crore contract to play only in franchise leagues. Aakash Chopra questioned whether a player from the West Indies would have been able to turn down such a big offer.

Mohammed Shami breaks silence on Australia tour snub India fast bowler Mohammed Shami has broken his silence on his snub from the tour of Australia. Shami has revealed that he is currently fit and available for selection.

India face do-or-die double vs Singapore as Sunil Chhetri returns under Khalid Jamil India faces a crucial test in AFC Asian Cup qualifiers as they take on Singapore in Singapore. Veteran Sunil Chhetri returns, while Khalid Jamil looks to steady the Blue Tigers' campaign in this do-or-die clash.

Harshit Rana arrives at Gautam Gambhir's team dinner in swanky BMW India fast bowler Harshit Rana arrived at Gautam Gambhir's dinner party in a swanky BMW. The Indian head coach hosted a team session ahead of the 2nd Test match vs West Indies.

Mitchell Starc returns to BBL after 11 years, set to play for Sydney Sixers Mitchell Starc is set to return to the Big Bash League after an 11-year hiatus, joining Sydney Sixers for BBL 15. His recent T20I retirement has opened the door for the pacer to focus on franchise cricket following the Ashes.

Aakash Chopra questioned whether a player from the West Indies would have been able to turn down such a big offer.

Mitchell Starc returns to BBL after 11 years, set to play for Sydney Sixers Mitchell Starc is set to return to the Big Bash League after an 11-year hiatus, joining Sydney Sixers for BBL 15. His recent T20I retirement has opened the door for the pacer to focus on franchise cricket following the Ashes.

Gautam Gambhir snubbed: How to read Rohit Sharma's viral Champions Trophy tributeRohit Sharma's Champions Trophy tribute to Rahul Dravid has raised eyebrows for one glaring omission: head coach Gautam Gambhir. While Dravid's influence on India's success is undeniable, the timing of Rohit's viral speech has only added fuel to the rumour mills.

Daniil Medvedev lashes out at referee in yet another on-court meltdownRussian tennis player Daniil Medvedev faced yet another on-court meltdown in the Shanghai Masters. Warned for service delays, Medvedev reacted sharply to umpire's code violation.

Alyssa Healy not dwelling on batting disaster ahead of crucial India gameAustralia nearly faced a massive disaster in Colombo against Pakistan. However, skipper Alyssa Healy remains unfazed ahead of their crucial India clash.

Barcelona heads to USA: LaLiga confirms first-ever outside Spain fixtureLaLiga will stage its first-ever official league match outside Spain as Villarreal hosts Barcelona in Miami on December 20, 2025. The decision, approved by UEFA, represents a significant moment for European football but has sparked controversy regarding fan interests and tradition.

Smriti Mandhana's World Cup form not a big worry for India: Sushma VermaVeteran wicketkeeper Sushma Verma feels Smriti Mandhana's slow start in the Women's World Cup isn't alarming, as players like Jemimah Rodrigues and Harmanpreet Kaur can step up.
After India snub, Mohammed Shami set to make Ranji Trophy return for BengalFast bowler Mohammed Shami made his return to the Bengal Ranji side. Shami, was not picked for the white-ball tour of India.

IND vs WI: Captain Shubman Gill shares batting tips, gives throw-downs to Sai SudharsanAhead of the second Test against West Indies, India captain Shubman Gill was seen mentoring Sai Sudharsan during practice in Delhi. The young opener received batting tips and throw-downs as he looks to regain form.

Vizag weather report: Will rain ruin India's crucial group-stage game?India vs South Africa: Inclement weather in Vizag is set to threaten what promises to be an exciting encounter in Vizag. Will the match get washed out today?

Smriti Mandhana's World Cup form not a big worry for India: Sushma VermaVeteran wicketkeeper Sushma Verma feels Smriti Mandhana's slow start in the Women's World Cup isn't alarming, as players like Jemimah Rodrigues and Harmanpreet Kaur can step up.

The young opener received batting tips and throw-downs as he looks to regain form.

Vizag weather report: Will rain ruin India's crucial group-stage game?India vs South Africa: Inclement weather in Vizag is set to threaten what promises to be an exciting encounter in Vizag. Will the match get washed out today?

In stormy Vizag, India eye smooth sailing against upbeat South AfricaIndia vs South Africa, Women's World Cup: Unbeaten so far, hosts India will have to shake off their cautious approach in the coastal city of Vizag when they face a rejuvenated South Africa on Thursday, aiming to inject much-needed momentum into their sluggish ICC Women's World Cup campaign.

Harshit Rana's selection questionable, but people shouldn't troll him: R AshwinRavichandran Ashwin has defended young fast bowler Harshit Rana amid criticism over his India selection and urged fans to avoid making personal attacks on the fast bowler.

Jemimah confident but India's misfiring top-order faces litmus test vs SAIndia may be unbeaten, but their much-vaunted top order has failed to fire against less-fancied opponents in the home Women's World Cup. While Jemimah Rodrigues has downplayed concerns around the top order, India must address these batting concerns quickly to avoid any costly slips.

Parking aside 2022 no-ball nightmare, India eye redemption heist against South AfricaBack in 2022, India's Women's World Cup campaign ended in heartbreak after a loss to South Africa in Christchurch. This time, they will be aiming for redemption on Thursday in Vizag.

Treat Rohit and Virat with respect and sensitivity, not doubt: Ashwin tells BCCIFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin calls for greater respect and clearer communication for senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. He emphasises the importance of handling leadership changes with sensitivity and ensuring knowledge transfer to younger cricketers.

IND vs WI: India confident Sudharsan can crack the Test code despite modest returnsIndia remains confident in Sai Sudharsan's Test potential despite early inconsistency. The team believes his domestic form and backing will help him succeed amid tough competition.

India to remain unchanged for Delhi Test, Nitish to get another go: Assistant coachIndia are set to field the same playing XI for the second Test against West Indies at Arun Jaitley Stadium. The team management aims to develop Nitish Kumar Reddy as a seam-bowling all-rounder by providing him more game time, revealed assistant coach Ryan Ten Doeschate.

South Africa over England collapse, confident ahead of India clash: Nadine de KlerkNadine de Klerk believes that South Africa have moved past their poor showing in the tournament-opener and fancy their chances of taking on the hosts, India on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
